website_summaries.verdict: A strong fishing line that doesn't break easily, but some have had problems with tangling.
pros: Heavy-duty line that lives up to its advertised strength
cons: This line can get tangled easily and the dye may fade after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Defective or counterfeit. What I received is worthless
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using spider wire for years but this spool I just purchased is worthless. My first cast I hooked a 3 lb bass and the line snapped at the spool. I thought maybe it was a fluke and pulled out several feet and retied. The next two fish never made it to the boat. The line snapped every time I hooked a fish. I had a feeling something was wrong because it cut way to easy with my knife. I’m afraid to even try the second spool I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Jeep guy

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch?
customer_reviews.text: I must have received a bad spool because this was some weak line. I'm getting a different brand because I can't risk losing the big one.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn D Hassell

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Casted about ten or twelve times and the line broke. Okay that could be my fault so i spooled out enough to get to the new line underneath. Cast two more time and the line broke off at the spool. Very strange! I’ve never had that happen before, but for braided line, it’s almost unheard of. Well, until now. Now im out two decent lures and 100 percent of my patience. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst line ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst line ever. After 2 lost fish I took every bit of line off my reel. I went to set the hook and the line snapped both times. The line looked like it stretched until it snapped. Not worth the money. Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Allie McGuire

customer_reviews.title: DEPENDABLE, TRUSTWORTHY
customer_reviews.text: Been using Spider Wire for years. Great stuff.......but I swear KastKing braid is the same at half the price. Used them side by side, while I have trusted Spider Wire without question, I have switched to KastKing.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY b

customer_reviews.title: crank bait must
customer_reviews.text: great line for top-water crank-baits near lilly-pads or weeds when you know you might get hung-up.30 lb test = 8 lb test is stamped on the spool. so the line thickness is the same as 8 lb test mono with the break strength of 30 lb test mono. the green color is a little shade of gray and blends in the water very well. I notice that i'm getting longer casts and less line twist, so this is a mono up-grade to me. tight lines and good fishing to all.
customer_reviews.author: danamulTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: I've fished it 3 times now and everyti.e same issue, this line snaps I'm using a double uni knot. Its definitely not my knot. When I snap off I bring in my line to a frayed edge. It doesn't come packaged like real spider wire at bass pro either. I feel like this is a knock of product
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great line, put this on a cheap-o Wal-Mart 8' saltwater rod/reel. It definitely casts farther/smooth than it used to. Make sure to either use gloves, or do like I did and put masking tape or something on your finger if you'll be doing a lot of casting. After a while, the line will eat into your finger a lot compared to monofilament. And if something unusual happens it can quickly rip your skin open if you try to grab it, so be careful! It definitely has much more "feel" to it as it doesn't stretch, although it is harder to tie in some regards since you're not supposed to use the "regular" cinch knot on braid.
customer_reviews.author: A. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Poor castability.
customer_reviews.text: Stealth translucent line. Definitely not anywhere near invisible in clear water, more like high visibility line. This line also has a tacky feeling that probably contributes to its poor castability. cut my casting distance by half or better. Very abrasion resistant and knots well, but I would not recommend this line at all.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Baker

customer_reviews.title: Line bleeds dye!
customer_reviews.text: I put this line on a brand new 13 Origin C - a white reel. First day out and the line bled the green dye all over the reel and on my fingers. A little bit of dye bleed is normal but it was just too much. The line wheel actually smelled a little like fresh paint. Maybe I got a bad line batch. I am returning for Prime refund.
customer_reviews.author: GDS

customer_reviews.title: Ugh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this line for a Canada fishing trip, to use with my muskey reel. Worst experience ever! So I’m a little obsessive when it comes to realigning my reels; after I rely on my real once I hit the water I let the whole spool out so that I can get my line tight (like always) my first cast after that was a rats nest and not just the average rat nest... I had to cut all the line out. I’m a huge SpiderWire that’s all I run with my set ups and I was highly aggravated by this. Will not be buying this type on line again! I will still run SpiderWire.
customer_reviews.author: J Lindstrom

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome braid for the price. I haven't had any problems with it and it holds up great. I use 15lb camo braid and a 10lb flouro leader for 3-7 lb largemouth bass. I use a uni to uni knot (8 wraps on each side) for the leader and a double palomar knot for the hook/swevel.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Translucent braid
customer_reviews.text: 9/10 times I fish with braid and I only use Stealthbraid from Spiderwire. I have never lost a fish due to line snap or have I not been able to free a snagged lure. I have always used the dark green, but recently bought the translucent. I have been extremely pleased with it. Same quality line that looks like regular fishing line?! This is my new go to braid for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Extremely high quality line with excellent consistency
customer_reviews.text: I surf fish 100-130 days a year and freshwater fish 30-70 days a year. I use this line in 6, 20, 30, and 50lb test. Its the best braid available, end of story. When you're fighting 40lb saltwater fish in heavy structure and need your line to hold up, or relying on 1lb equivalent line to not tangle, it better be good. This is better then good, it's the best. It's also expensive, but I think it's worth it. Whats the point of an expensive rod and reel if you don't have good line? It's like tires for a car.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Audet

customer_reviews.title: New to using braid.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a lifelong monofilament guy. I decided to give braid a try and Spiderwire was the only choice to make. Accidentally ordered the 65 pound version, but decided to keep it and give it a try. Glad I kept it. Using it on two of my baitcasters right now, and don’t plan on switching it out anytime soon. Casts good, good sensitivity, and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Wont do it again
customer_reviews.text: I've used Spiderwire for years! I have heard so much about the camouflage line so I thought I'd give it a try. I wish I would have stuck with the green. This line seems to have a different texture and the fibers seem to be not woven as tight. I'll be sticking with what has worked in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Michael and Linda Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Wind knot prone
customer_reviews.text: Florida fisherman , first time out today with this line . Very strong . However there was minimal wind today and I must have lost almost half of a spool today in about 2 hours with the non stop wind knots while casting . Would have lost over half of the spool if not for me picking a couple wind knots out . Do not recommend. Wish I could get my money back .
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: Changed review from negative to positive!
customer_reviews.text: I had to change my previous review because I was certain the line kept snapping, as others have complained of. But I learned that a clinch knot is the WRONG knot to use with braided line. Switched to a Palomar knot and haven't had a failure yet. My apologies for the previous negative review.
customer_reviews.author: NuGroovJazzBassPlayer alanealane

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible!!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE! I would never use this line again, even if it was given to me!! It won't cast worth a darn, AND it broke while casting a 2 oz weight and a medium hook!! Definitely NOT worth it! This is a waste of time and is a terrible product! Safe yourself the time, hastle, and money! DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can't get hooked on this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Glows great in the dark. You can see it break with ease. 50# line broke on the first three hooksets while bass fishing. Lost the fish plus about $20.00 worth of lures. I have used Spider Wire braided line for years with excellent results. But, this stuff, more like spider web.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Suggest you burn the tip of the braided line to keep the braids tight
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this braided line for a couple of utrilight fishing set ups. I love the line, so strong and lays well on your reels. After cutting the line I burn the tip of the braided line and then tie on my lure and trim the line and burn the tip of the line to keep the line braid tight
customer_reviews.author: Charles Harris

customer_reviews.title: Super thin and cast like a bullet ..must have for light set up..
customer_reviews.text: 20lb braided..Ok this product I have on a Penn fierce 3. 4000.on a 7Ft medium big water ugly stick...and man I love it for light set up..my go to getter in fresh water to..honestly not for novice or beginner Fisher man ...the line wind knots a lot and tangle easily..but for season veterans must have for light tackle.I use power pro slick 30lb and power pro regular on my heavier set ups..
customer_reviews.author: Cappuccino

customer_reviews.title: Line weakens after use, check for cuts in the line often
customer_reviews.text: I lost three lures casting on this stuff. I had some backlashes and my Dr Spoons went flying away, it was frustrating. I am upgrading to 40 lb. line and will see if this happens with stronger line. I did manage to pull in 4 pike over 36 inches on this line though. So, it did hold up once the fish were hooked and the rod was supporting the line.
customer_reviews.author: DrKegger

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I spooled this on to a couple of reels in the 30lb flavor. Fished south west FL for a week and have cut away most of this stuff from wind knots, birds nests, etc.. It also didn't hold its color beyond the first day. Could be I got a counterfeit batch, this is something one has to worry about on A-maz-on. Definitely can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BoatCamperTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Best Line ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have used the spiderwire 20lb 8 core for many years and have never had a single problem with it. I currently have it on 4 poles and use exclusively in saltwater
customer_reviews.author: DAVID CZERWINSKI

customer_reviews.title: Tried because recommendation
customer_reviews.text: I tried this line out based on a recommendation but I just don't ever see it being worth the price. I use cheap braided line from a local bait shop and it is much stronger than this.
customer_reviews.author: Dasol Won

customer_reviews.title: Using this in my garden
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to place in my garden for a plant that needed a guide to grow on and I didn’t want to use a traditional trellis in this particular area of my garden. I bought this product based on its durability claims in the description. It has held up beautifully n my garden. The heavy vine did not break it. The value is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: yellowtaffy313

customer_reviews.title: Great for master baiting 👍🏿👍🏿👍🏿👨🏿
customer_reviews.text: When you’re chunking huge cut bait for gigantic hog donkey mule cats it’s crucial to use braid. When I master bait I use braid and stick monster brush beasts at the hollow!! Gonna hammer Cholo point soon and hopefully get to slam some whiskers.
customer_reviews.author: chris tollis

customer_reviews.title: disappears in the water and remains flexible.
customer_reviews.text: it's a good strong line, use sharp clipper to cut the line. it remains flexible and reels up nicely on the spool. doesn't have the memory issues of other lines. you can pull pretty good if your bait gets stuck on the rocks or snags.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Good braid.
customer_reviews.text: I love spiderwire. I have had no issues with this line. I always pair it with Trilene monofilament backing and leader.
customer_reviews.author: JJC

customer_reviews.title: awesome smooth and hols knots well.
customer_reviews.text: this is a great choice for deep drop fishing. I caught around twenty five very large grouper and a few black fin tuna with this line on a manual two speed reel. not one break off and good sensitivity. This line was smooth and quiet in my guides with a Diawa rod and held the FG knot to my shock leader with zero failures.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin B.

customer_reviews.title: Weaker than rated. SNAP!
customer_reviews.text: My first try with spider wire on my bait caster. I was happy with how it spooled but the line broke far too easily. It felt like it was defective with weak points that are far below the rated strength. Two lures broke free. Lucky for me they were top water and I was able to retrieve them.
customer_reviews.author: Bostonian88

customer_reviews.title: Too strong???
customer_reviews.text: I love this line, I am making wind chimes with it...Very very strong!!! My only problem is that my small craft wire cutters aren't quite strong enough to get a good cut on it. Need to look into purchasing something stronger as snips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This line is fantastic. We caught lots of big reds and sea ...
customer_reviews.text: This line is fantastic. We caught lots of big reds and sea trout on it. We hooked up to a really big Cobia which I have no doubt this line could have handled. Unfortunately I was using 20lb leader which snapped. Oh well, I'g now using at least 30 lb leader with it and I'll get em next time.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: This product cannot be the real thing. The line broke every single time a fish was on the hook and simply had to throw it away. The box says Spider wire but the product is just trash and my guess is it counterfeit. A complete waste of my time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: but I am super glad that this happened
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I could not find an orange one, but I am super glad that this happened. This one matches perfectly with my orange Whisper Seeker fishing pole. I used it to catch some catfish this weekend and it did not break once. It also got caught and i liked that it did not break easily. Will deft. buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great for when you gotta drop a line
customer_reviews.text: Great like, smooth casting. Strong line. But the whole “glow-vis” thing is meh. Not sure how the fish see it under water but it’s not “extra” visible above the water. Can still see it but doesn’t stick out like you’re lead to believe. Having said this I do recommend, I have a few reels of it
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Cangialosi

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great performance
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy the camo blue, watched a YouTube video and still thought I made a mistake. The. I used it. The performance and feel was phenomenal. I used it in a light medium rod and a medium heavy rod and had a great day on the water
customer_reviews.author: J-Ro

customer_reviews.title: A bit costly for the amount you get
customer_reviews.text: While it is a top brand and has been around for a long time. The cost just doesn't justify the amount of line in my opinion. 125 yards of line isn't that much. Then again it's all relative to what you are doing with it.
customer_reviews.author: BullNY

customer_reviews.title: Bass "It's so much more interesting looking than that boring mono line"
customer_reviews.text: 8 out of 10 fish approve. A. Bass "It's so much more interesting looking than that boring mono line". L. Walleye "Got to admit... it sure looks nice and flashy! I can't break it though... so I have mixed views on it. Just gotta hope for a catch-and-release."
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: It is very durable
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely as advertised. Ive used it for paylake carp and catfishing on my baitcasters and spinning reels. 50lb test blue/white/black is what I'm using it has faded mostly to white at this point but that was anticipated. Only 1 break but it was beat up and I knew I should've stripped a few feet off before recasting. When you string your reels you must do it a certain way which you tube can teach you or it wont preform well at all. Breaks/tangles
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Um, the label says Moss Green but this is definitely not moss green
customer_reviews.text: Just received, and was kicking myself for ordering the wrong color. Then I checked my order: yep, I ordered Moss Green. Then I checked the label on the spool: Moss Green. This is NOT moss green. This is a color that's not even offered on this version on Amazon. It's just clear? Based on this and the recent reviews I'm scared to spool this stuff on, will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Love this fishing line
customer_reviews.text: I have this Spiderwire stealth braid on almost every reel i own. I really like the transparent color. It seems to be much more difficult for the fish to spot. I tie a 20-30 lb leader on to it with an FG knot.
customer_reviews.author: Dailey Life Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Put this braid on some of my poles,have to take it off!!! I don't want to loose any more lures!!!
customer_reviews.text: This braid fraid way to easy broke off 3 different lures one was a big Bass on one day of fishing!!! Brand New Line can't be,do not buy this braid very disappointed,going to take off my poles! Look's good and that's about it!
customer_reviews.author: Kraig Kryger

customer_reviews.title: Product used or taken part of the spool line
customer_reviews.text: The Box was open and the spool white sticker that holds the braid fishing line was removed and loose plus line unwinded could had been used or taken part of the line out.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: This is a long lasting line that does not bird nest using a spinning reel. I have had it on my reel for over a year and when I replaced it, it was still super strong and would not break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my new rod n reel setup by Abu Garcia.. lost 6 lures due to it being defective.. I tested the line with just pulling and snapped it multiple times by hand..
customer_reviews.author: Tj Smith

customer_reviews.title: Loving the braid.
customer_reviews.text: Trying braid for the first time. Mostly top water so far. Nice to be able to horse them biguns or if the reeds and hydrilla. Also bought KK fluoro. Best bargain in line.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Delsack

customer_reviews.title: I really love this product
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product. I just got back into fishing. I fished a lot when i was a kid.10 years later. Bought a fishing boat. And started buying this line again. I love it. Caught many fish with it.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: finniky junk that rubs your eyelets raw and casts poorly
customer_reviews.text: junk... between same gauge trilene and spiderwire, i'll never try spider wire again...it may not curl but its only slick on knots, grabs everything else like it was velcro..
customer_reviews.author: musicmonster

customer_reviews.text: What a stupid way to label line size, i thought i was buying 12 pound and got 40. Who cares what size line its comparable to, all any angler needs to know is what pound test it is. wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Moonbeam

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Spider Wire ain't just awesome fishing line, it's great utility cord to have around the house for a variety of things from the workshop to the garden. Keep some around. Would've preferred a spool with a little notch to hold the line in place.
customer_reviews.author: Thorny

customer_reviews.title: The Color Rubs Off on Hands Easily
customer_reviews.text: I have been fishing with braid for years and tried this brand. The color rubs off on my hands and makes a mess when providing steady tension reeling in.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: ... this stuff is strong an slides through the guides like mono an the translucent color works great for trolling ...
customer_reviews.text: By far the thinnest an smoothest braid out I've put it through the ringer grouper fishing with a 6/0 an the drag tapped down with a hammer so there's no drag at all this stuff is strong an slides through the guides like mono an the translucent color works great for trolling you can see it well arrived on time
customer_reviews.author: Avid Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Dosent glow. Dosent even reflect light to give the appearance that it's glowing. Still super strong though and about the same price as all the other colors so it's not all bad. I just wanted something I could see a little better while night fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Line worth it, just not in High Vis Yellow
customer_reviews.text: Sadly the color does not hold I mean gone in a day. I bought both 15 & 50 lbs and both faded in hours once in sun and water. Don't get me wrong, line is great just does not hold the color I wished to have.... thats why I bought the high vis yellow in the first place
customer_reviews.author: Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: It does not vanish in semi-merky water as hoped for, but it is a fantastic white line and the white finish definitely dissipates after the line submerges.
customer_reviews.author: Cdeazy

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy fisherman
customer_reviews.text: Was very unhappy with the fishing line. Broke four times in one evening. Broke in different places so I know it's not my real or pole. Might of been a bad role but either way it cost to much to have to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Walker

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate line
customer_reviews.text: Not sure where the bad reviews are coming from, it’s pricey but you can’t buy line better than this stuff from anyone, anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: John Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Soft line with fewer tangles
customer_reviews.text: Pretty limp and cast-able. Not as prone to bedding in and wind knots as some other braids I have tried. I like the alternating colors because it gives good contrast to track my line as it drifts.
customer_reviews.author: D. Palm

customer_reviews.title: Do not order !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the real spider wire you can put this braid in your hands and snap it dental floss is stronger then this line very disappointed!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: angelo

customer_reviews.title: Great strength
customer_reviews.text: I used this at a lake that has more than expected stumps and and Lilly pads. And with all the seaweed and lily pads I never even thought of my line snapping. I did get caught on a stump and my hook broke before my line did.
customer_reviews.author: geoff Treibley

customer_reviews.title: Casting was good
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little time getting use to the type of line. It did break twice , however it could have been because I cut the extra line to short. I have daughter 2 nice 16 inch rainbow tryouts so far. Seems to cast good.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Roldan

customer_reviews.title: Decent Line
customer_reviews.text: Strong braid but it has a big issue with wind knots. Have it on a saltist reel and I get irritated with it. Jbraid on another saltist and have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Syers

customer_reviews.title: KNOT, special.
customer_reviews.text: I use this line to tie special gig rigs, works great. It really works in all water color and knots hold well. Also use it for leaders.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I've been fishing for the better part of 40 years. This line is garbage. Three casts, wind knot, re-tie an Albright. Three more casts, wind knot, re-tie an Albright.
customer_reviews.author: Druid

customer_reviews.title: Trust spiderwire
customer_reviews.text: Superior fishing line than other brands, it doesn’t fade. I’ve snagged 200 lbs branches and pulled them from the muck with it before and still saved my lures. Muskie and pike can’t bite through it so no need for a 150 lbs steel leader.I’ve fished with 4 other braided companies and this one doesn’t have flaws
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Thin superline
customer_reviews.text: Very small diameter, 65lb entire 200yard spool fits on 6k pen fierce 2 with room to spare. Compared to 75-100 of diawa 8x 65lb. Eager try 80lb
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: Good line, not sure if it camos the line though.
customer_reviews.text: Very good line. I liked the idea of the blue camo, not that it is something I think the fish can't see. I have no issues catching fish no matter what the color of my line. I bought this because it was on sale and I wanted to see blue line on my reel. It is of good quality though, I have always liked Spiderwire.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Superb Line
customer_reviews.text: I have used this line fir years without any problems. Spiderwire in my experience is by far the best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: basser175

customer_reviews.title: Great Line!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using spider wire for over 30 years! Never had a problem! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: PJDSR

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best braid I have, starting from color, feel and strength. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matemk

customer_reviews.title: Decent line. Low visibility and catch about everything on it
customer_reviews.text: Decent line. Ive been using braid for 10 years and usually always go back to Spiderwire. Only complaint I have is I caught a 9 lb. Carp and noticed parts of my line had been flattened and were no longer round most likely due to the force but still something to note.
customer_reviews.author: Kolby N.

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: I like the diameter of the line. Abrasion resistance is a must in Hawaii. Alot of reefs.
customer_reviews.author: Walter b wroten

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This line has held up great! I've had it cought on weeds and pulled on it a bunch throught the summer and has yet to break!
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Line
customer_reviews.text: Value for the money, the photo is misleading it's not a spool it flat spool.
customer_reviews.author: PAPPA4

customer_reviews.title: i can say spiderwire is by far the best braid line in the market
customer_reviews.text: there is so many braid line brands out there, but after trying different ones, i can say spiderwire is by far the best braid line in the market, i have this line on a couple of spinning reels [20lbs], a baitcaster [15 lbs] and a spincasting reel[20lbs], never had any issues or tangling, not even one backlash[bird's nest] , strong line for the diameter ..
customer_reviews.author: Mr.MousaTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great line for your super fisher man. Caught a huge big mout bass on this awesome line!
customer_reviews.author: nice27

customer_reviews.title: Best braid
customer_reviews.text: This has become my favorite line very strong and cast very well.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Lester

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Only brand of braid I use. Been using it for years. See no reason to ever switch. Never had any issues. Use heavy 20 to 40 on baitcaster and 10 to 15 on all my spinning gear. Flip it the next year and replace it every three
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Line fades VERY fast.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the hi-vis reason. Line faded from green to white very quickly. Waste of money. Wouldn’t purchase again. Hard to send back line after it’s been spooled but if I could I would. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality! Great Color!
customer_reviews.text: Spiderwire is my favorite and to make it pink camo it could not get any better than this. It is the same high quality line in a color I love.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Russell

customer_reviews.title: Spiderwire hi viz braided line
customer_reviews.text: Easily seen on top of the water , very strong , holds knots well , casts easy
customer_reviews.author: Kenny S

customer_reviews.title: Nice line
customer_reviews.text: Wished it were little brighter but Overall good strong line
customer_reviews.author: Eric T

customer_reviews.title: Bought 300YD to re-do two reels but once I received ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 300YD to re-do two reels but once I received it I realized that the line is so thin it would probably only fill one reel. Wish I had bought a heavier braid to fill both reels. Now I need a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Pincher

customer_reviews.title: DECENT
customer_reviews.text: I DON'T KNOW ENOUGH YET ABOUT BRAID, BUT I THINK IT WILL WORK
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Frays easy
customer_reviews.text: Frays easily. When tying on my lures and hooks, it seems the braid just comes undone which makes me uneasy.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Best braid on the market
customer_reviews.text: Can handle any fish I catch in the Chesapeake Bay and offshore wrecks, I have some spider wire braid that is over 25 years old and is still catching fish with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: lassardl

customer_reviews.title: Pink camo!!!
customer_reviews.text: Looooove! I love camo and I love pink so naturally I had to buy this pink camo line!! I was afraid I wouldn’t catch anything when fishing for lake trout, but that was not the case!! I also loved watching the changing color as I reeled in!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is very high quality. It is very thin, but I have caught trout without problem. It is sturdy and works well. When casting a gentle breeze will take the line far, so beware of that and perhaps something heavier for that.
customer_reviews.author: dLyonBW

customer_reviews.title: Long casts
customer_reviews.text: Just bought 2 spools of 15lb and it casts like a bullet. Added at least 25% to my casting distance and it is very thin. Wish I could find the same deal on some 20lb
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Great line
customer_reviews.text: Amazing line. Used it on a medium action spinning rod to catch snook. Casts just as good as pricey 8lb floro.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Overholser

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Spider wire is my go to line. 20-100 lb. best price and never have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M. Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Great line
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camo version. U can't believe how thin it is for 50lb test. I got the whole 500 yds on my avet mxl
customer_reviews.author: john u

customer_reviews.title: It is smooth to cast easier
customer_reviews.text: It is smooth. It dose come off the spinner very easily and gose throw the eyelet easy. I have only tried 3/8 oz sofar
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Braided Fish line is new for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new spinning reel and I will put this on and try it. It claims to be stronger. I put it to the test by lifting double the lb weight. It feels slick and has no memory. I tested my knots. There not coming undone. So far I'm impressed
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: TOUGH
customer_reviews.text: Works great in the ponds by my residence. Fish were just eating up my green texas rig, confidence in pulling in a fish through thick grass with this line is amazing, no longer will I be losing hooks or lures.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Q.

customer_reviews.title: Invisible line
customer_reviews.text: Awesome package and design. Feels great and fills up a small reel. Could not even see the line when spooling the reel inside.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shillingburg

customer_reviews.title: Second time I've bought it, love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. Second time I have used this on a reel. Holds up good, has close to rated breaking strength, looks great. I like having the color change to help judge how fast/much line has left the rod.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Snap, snap, snap. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This line has been snapping, lost 2 corks and 2 fish in one morning. Will not buy this brand again
customer_reviews.author: Perez-Martinez

product_meta.title: SpiderWire Stealth Superline Fishing Line
product_meta.description: SpiderWire Stealth Blue Camo is uniquely colored for blue water lakes and saltwater conditions. New and improved Stealth braid is constructed to provide ultimate strength with the thinnest diameter for smooth and quiet performance. The no stretch properties of SiderWire's PE fibers provide incredible sensitivity to instantly detect bites and structure. Varying blue/white/black color pattern design to blend naturally with open blue water conditions. Color-lock coating technology casts father and lasts longer. Dyneema PE Microfiber construction is strong, smooth and round. Fluoropolymer treated microfibers shoots through guides like a bullet! Wisper quiet for stealth attacks", resists diggin in" on reels. Line measures 200 yards (183 meters) and is available in 20 lbs. to 100 lbs. (9 kg. to 45.4 kg) test (see above size dropdown menu for selections).
feature_bullets: Sleek and durable braided fishing line designed to cast further and last longer
Strong, smooth, and round Dyneema polyethylene microfibers for quiet performance
Color-Lock coating technology holds in color and resists fading

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
